message_1: What is the smallest prime factor of the number 187?
message_2:
The smallest prime factor of 187 is found by dividing the number by the smallest prime numbers until we find a factor. 

187 ÷ 2 = 93.5 (not divisible by 2 since it's not an even number)

187 ÷ 3 ≈ 62.333 (not divisible by 3)

187 ÷ 5 = 37.4 (not divisible by 5)

187 ÷ 7 ≈ 26.714 (not divisible by 7)

187 ÷ 11 ≈ 17 (not divisible by 11)

187 ÷ 13 ≈ 14.385 (not divisible by 13)

187 ÷ 17 = 11 (divisible by 17)

So, the smallest prime factor of 187 is 17.
